name: simulated

made to look like or have the features of something else: The community has held training sessions, including a simulated attack. a simulated leather handbag See
simulate
More examplesFewer examplesThe two men were killed while performing simulated aerial combat with another aircraft.She dug amongst the bottles of aspirin and loose hairpins in her black simulated leather handbag.Actual or simulated marketing presentations may be taped and played back for appraisal. Students develop the ability identify disorders in real and simulated patients.
